It is characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of leaves, a feature that gives it its scientific name. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in mountainous areas with high humidity. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, usually greenish or yellowish in color, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
